sen.j: 桐壺帝/桐壺院（きりつぼてい・きりつぼのみかど／きりつぼいん）は、『源氏物語』に登場する一番目の帝（在位「桐壺」～「花宴」）。
sen.e: Emperor Kiritsubo/Kiritsubo-in is the first Emperor in "The Tale of Genji" (the period of reign: from the chapter of 'Kiritsubo' (The Paulownia Court) to 'Hana no En' (The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms)).

Emperor Kiritsubo/Kiritsubo-in is the first Emperor in "The Tale of Genji" (the period of reign: from the chapter of 'Kiritsubo' (The Paulownia Court) to 'Hana no En' (The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms)).

Emperor Kiritsubo/Kiritsubo-in is the first Emperor in "The Tale of Genji" (the period of reign: from the chapter of 'Kiritsubo' [The Paulownia Court] to 'Hana no En' [The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms]).
sen.cmt: 括弧内の括弧を[]に変更

sen.e: A fictitious character.
A fictitious character.
A fictitious character.
Omiya was his sister.
sen.cmt: （源氏物語）はリンク先の語のため、訳出しませんでした。
sen.e: Omiya was his sister.
Omiya was his sister.

sen.j: 桐壺更衣を寵愛したため、「桐壺帝」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Because he favored Kiritsubo no koi (lower class court lady), he was called 'Emperor Kiritsubo.'
Because he favored Kiritsubo no koi (lower class court lady), he was called 'Emperor Kiritsubo.'
Because he favored Kiritsubo no koi (lower class court lady), he was called 'Emperor Kiritsubo.'

sen.j: 『源氏物語』の主人公光源氏の父親である。
sen.e: He was the father of Hikaru Genji, the main character of "The Tale of Genji."
He was the father of Hikaru Genji, the main character of "The Tale of Genji."
He was the father of Hikaru Genji, the main character of "The Tale of Genji."

sen.j: 他の有力な妃を差し置いて桐壺更衣を偏愛し、やがて源氏が誕生するが、更衣はその心労が祟って病死する。
sen.e: He favored Kiritsubo no koi, ignoring other powerful wives, and before long Genji was born, but the anxieties made her sick, and she died of disease.
He favored Kiritsubo no koi, ignoring other powerful wives, and before long Genji was born, but anxieties made her sick, and she died of disease.
He favored Kiritsubo no koi, ignoring other powerful wives, and before long Genji was born, but anxieties made her sick, and she died of disease.

sen.j: 悲しみに暮れる桐壺帝を見かねた周囲のすすめにより、亡き桐壺更衣に瓜二つである藤壺（先帝の第四皇女）を入内させて寵愛し、第十皇子（後の冷泉帝）を産んだのを機に中宮に据えた。
sen.e: Emperor Kiritsubo experienced deep grief so much that those around him could not look on with indifference, and encouraged him to have Fujitsubo (the fourth princess of the previous Emperor), who looked exactly like late Kiritsubo no koi, enter the Imperial court, and he favored her, making her the Empress when she gave birth to the tenth prince (later known as Emperor Reizei).

Emperor Kiritsubo experienced so much deep grief that those around him could not look on with indifference, and encouraged him to have Fujitsubo (the fourth princess of the previous Emperor), who looked exactly like late Kiritsubo no koi, enter the Imperial court, and he favored her, making her the Empress when she gave birth to the tenth prince (later known as Emperor Reizei).

Emperor Kiritsubo experienced so much deep grief that those around him could not look on with indifference, and encouraged him to have Fujitsubo (the fourth princess of the previous Emperor), who looked exactly like late Kiritsubo no koi, enter the Imperial court, and he favored her, making her the Empress when she gave birth to the tenth prince (later known as Emperor Reizei).

sen.j: なお冷泉帝は、実は光源氏と藤壺との不義の子であるが、桐壺帝がそのことを知っていたかどうかは作中では語られない。
sen.e: In fact, Emperor Reizei was an illicit child between Hikaru Genji and Fujitsubo, but it is not told in the tale whether Emperor Kiritsubo knew that.
In fact, Emperor Reizei was an illicit child between Hikaru Genji and Fujitsubo, but it is not told in the tale whether Emperor Kiritsubo knew that.
In fact, Emperor Reizei was an illicit child between Hikaru Genji and Fujitsubo, but it is not told in the tale whether Emperor Kiritsubo knew that.

sen.j: 「賢木」で病が重くなり、源氏23歳の年に崩御。
sen.e: His sick got worse in the chapter of 'Sakaki' (The Green Branch), and he passed away when Genji was 23.
His sickness got worse in the chapter 'Sakaki' (The Green Branch), and he passed away when Genji was 23.
His sickness got worse in the chapter 'Sakaki' (The Green Branch), and he passed away when Genji was 23.

sen.j: 「明石」で亡霊として現れ、源氏の苦難を救う。
sen.e: In the chapter of 'Akashi,' his departed spirit appeared, and helped Genji in distress.
In the chapter 'Akashi,' his departed spirit appeared, and helped Genji when he was in distress.
In the chapter 'Akashi,' his departed spirit appeared, and helped Genji when he was in distress.
An ideal Emperor
An ideal Emperor
An ideal Emperor

sen.j: 聖代とされる醍醐天皇の時代がモデルとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the glorious reign of Emperor Daigo was the model.
It is said that the glorious reign of Emperor Daigo was the model.
It is said that the glorious reign of Emperor Daigo was the model.

sen.j: 弘徽殿女御（弘徽殿太后）…右大臣の娘。
sen.e: Kokiden no nyogo (Empress Kokiden) --- a daughter of Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
Kokiden no nyogo (Empress Kokiden) --- a daughter of Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
Kokiden no nyogo (Empress Kokiden) --- a daughter of Udaijin (Minister of the Right).

sen.j: 桐壺更衣…按察大納言の娘。
sen.e: Kiritsubo no koi --- a daughter of Azechi no Dainagon.
Kiritsubo no koi --- a daughter of Azechi no Dainagon.
Kiritsubo no koi --- a daughter of Azechi no Dainagon.

sen.j: 淑景舎に住まい、桐壺帝の寵愛を受ける。
sen.e: She lived in Shigeisha, being loved by Emperor Kiritsubo.
She lived in Shigeisha, and was loved by Emperor Kiritsubo.
She lived in Shigeisha, and was loved by Emperor Kiritsubo.

sen.j: 藤壺…先帝の四宮（第四皇女）。
sen.e: Fujitsubo --- the fourth princess of the previous Emperor.

sen.j: 麗景殿女御…花散里の姉。
sen.e: Reikeiden no nyogo (Lady Reikeiden) --- older sister of Hanachirusato.
Reikeiden no nyogo (Lady Reikeiden) --- older sister of Hanachirusato.
Reikeiden no nyogo (Lady Reikeiden) --- older sister of Hanachirusato.

sen.j: 帝崩御後、姉妹共に光源氏の庇護を受ける。
sen.e: Together with her sister, she was protected by Hikaru Genji after the Emperor's demise.
Together with her sister, she was protected by Hikaru Genji after the Emperor's demise.

sen.j: 承香殿女御…四の宮の母。
sen.e: Jokyoden no nyogo (The Lady of Jokyoden Palace) --- the mother of Shinomiya.

sen.j: 東宮時代の冷泉帝を廃しようとする陰謀に巻き込まれ隠棲。
sen.e: He lived in seclusion after he was involved in a political plot to depose Emperor Reizei, who was still in the Crown Prince.
He lived in seclusion after he was involved in a political plot to depose Emperor Reizei in the Togu era.
sen.cmt: Not sure if this is a decent translation, but I changed "who was still in the Crown Prince" to "in the Togu era"
sen.e: He lived in seclusion after he was involved in a political plot to depose Emperor Reizei when he was the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: ＮＣの訳文は違うので、書き換えました。

sen.j: 宇治十帖にのみ登場する。
sen.e: He appeared only in Uji jujo (The Ten Quires of Uji).

sen.j: 宇治の大君、中君、浮舟 の父。

sen.j: 「絵合」「梅枝」では判者を務めるなど、風流人。
